courses.title: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
courses.description: This course introduces students to the fundamental concepts of computer science and programming, using the programming language Scheme.

courses.title: Data Structures
courses.description: Introduction to the internal representation of data structures and analysis of algorithms.

courses.title: Machine Structures
courses.description: Introduction to the designing of computer architecture and the underlying principles of systems.

courses.title: Discrete Mathematics and Probability Theory
courses.description: Mathematical tools required for computer science, including topics from discrete mathematics, calculus, and probability.

courses.title: User Interface Design and Development
courses.description: Principles of user interface design, user-centered development, and evaluation.

courses.title: Computer Security
courses.description: The principles and practice of computer security, including encryption, authentication, and network security.

courses.title: Operating Systems and System Programming
courses.description: Concepts in operating systems: processes, concurrency, memory management, file systems, and more.

courses.title: Programming Languages and Compilers
courses.description: The structure of high-level programming languages and the fundamentals of translation.

courses.title: Software Engineering
courses.description: Techniques for designing and constructing reliable software systems.

courses.title: Foundations of Data Science
courses.description: Data 8 provides an introduction to data science, including statistical thinking, data analysis, and the basics of computer programming.

courses.title: Designing, Visualizing and Understanding Deep Neural Networks
courses.description: Deep Networks have revolutionized computer vision, language technology, robotics, and control. They have growing impact in many other areas of science and engineering.

courses.title: Introduction to Database Systems
courses.description: Database design and the use of database management systems for applications.

courses.title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
courses.description: Ideas and techniques underlying the design of intelligent computer systems.

courses.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
courses.description: Theoretical foundations, algorithms, methodologies, and applications for machine learning.

courses.title: Social Implications of Computer Technology
courses.description: Examination of the social implications of computer technology and the responsibilities of computer professionals in directing the emerging technology.

courses.title: Directed Group Study for Advanced Undergraduates
courses.description: Group study of selected topics in computer science, directed by one or more instructors.

courses.title: Supervised Independent Study for Advanced Undergraduates
courses.description: Independent study of advanced computer science topics under the supervision of a faculty member.

courses.title: Principles and Techniques of Data Science
courses.description: Statistical techniques and computational tools for large-scale data analysis.

courses.title: Operating Systems and System Programming
courses.description: Advanced topics in operating systems and system programming in a UNIX environment.

courses.title: Principles of Software Development
courses.description: Principles and techniques for software development, software life cycle, and project management.

courses.title: User Interface Design and Development
courses.description: Advanced study of principles and practices for designing and developing effective user interfaces.

courses.title: User Interface Design and Development
courses.description: Advanced study of principles and practices for designing and developing effective user interfaces.

courses.title: Computer Security
courses.description: A study of the principles and practices of computer security from a systems perspective.

courses.title: Applied Cryptography
courses.description: Cryptographic protocols and their application to secure communications, commerce, and web services.

courses.title: Advanced Topics in Operating Systems
courses.description: Selected topics in the design and implementation of operating systems and distributed systems.

courses.title: Database Systems
courses.description: Advanced topics in database systems, including data storage, query optimization, and transaction management.

courses.title: Combinatorial Algorithms and Data Structures
courses.description: Advanced algorithms and data structures with an emphasis on combinatorial and graph algorithms.

courses.title: Introduction to Theory of Computing
courses.description: Fundamental concepts in the theory of computation, including computability, complexity, and automata theory.

courses.title: Introduction to Machine Learning
courses.description: Machine learning theory, algorithms, and their application.

courses.title: Foundations of Parallel Computing
courses.description: Theoretical foundations and programming models for parallel computation.

courses.title: Computer Vision
courses.description: Theory and algorithms for understanding images and videos.

courses.title: Statistical Learning Theory
courses.description: A theoretical approach to learning from data, with a focus on statistical learning theory.

courses.title: Designing, Visualizing and Understanding Deep Neural Networks
courses.description: Deep networks have revolutionized computer vision, language technology, robotics, and control. This course explores the interplay between intuitive insights, theoretical modeling, practical implementations, empirical studies, and scientific analyses.

courses.title: Algorithms for Computational Biology
courses.description: Algorithms and statistical models for computational biology and bioinformatics.

courses.title: Topics in Algorithmic Game Theory
courses.description: Theoretical foundations of algorithmic game theory and its application to computer science.

courses.title: Algorithmic Human-Robot Interaction
courses.description: Development of algorithms for autonomous robots, focusing on human interaction and user feedback.

courses.title: Introduction to Computational Thinking with Data
courses.description: An introduction to computational thinking and quantitative reasoning preparing students for further coursework. Emphasizes computation to gain insight about quantitative problems with data from various domains.

courses.title: Foundations of Data Science
courses.description: Foundations of data science from three perspectives: inferential thinking, computational thinking, and real-world relevance. Critical concepts and skills in computer programming and statistical inference are taught.

courses.title: Data Science Connector
courses.description: Designed to be taken in conjunction with the Foundations of Data Science course, each connector course will flesh out data science ideas in the context of one particular field.

courses.title: Economic Models
courses.description: Motivate and illustrate key concepts in economics through exercises and examples using Python Jupyter notebooks.

courses.title: Computational Structures in Data Science
courses.description: Expands computational concepts and techniques of abstraction, understanding the structures that underlie programs, algorithms, and languages used in data science.

courses.title: Probability and Mathematical Statistics in Data Science
courses.description: A connector course that states precisely and proves results discovered while exploring data, covering probability, conditioning, independence, random variables, and distributions.

courses.title: Principles & Techniques of Data Science
courses.description: Explores the data science lifecycle, including question formulation, data collection and cleaning, exploratory data analysis, visualization, statistical inference, prediction, and decision-making.

courses.title: Data Engineering
courses.description: Covers the principles and practices of managing data at scale with a focus on use cases in data analysis and machine learning.

courses.title: Data Inference and Decisions
courses.description: Develops the probabilistic foundations of inference in data science and a comprehensive view of the modeling and decision-making lifecycle, including human, social, and ethical implications.

courses.title: Human Contexts and Ethics of Data
courses.description: Uses tools of applied historical thinking and Science, Technology, and Society (STS) to recognize, analyze, and shape the human contexts and ethics of data.

courses.title: Statistical Methods for Data Science
courses.description: Teaches a broad range of statistical methods used to solve data problems, with a focus on statistical computing and reproducible statistical analysis.

courses.title: Probability for Data Science
courses.description: An introduction to probability emphasizing the combined use of mathematics and programming, covering distributions, transforms, convergence, Markov chains, and Bayesian methods.

courses.title: Data Mining and Analytics
courses.description: Introduces practical fundamentals of data mining and machine learning with project-oriented learning.

courses.title: Advanced Data Science Connector
courses.description: Intensive study of data science ideas in a particular field, to be taken concurrently with or after Principles and Techniques of Data Science or Probability for Data Science.

courses.title: Data Science Honors Thesis Seminar
courses.description: Gives students an opportunity to do data science research, formulating a research problem, designing a strategy, collecting evidence, and writing up findings and analysis.

courses.title: Field Studies in Data Science
courses.description: Students take part in field sponsored programs with off-campus organizations relevant to data science.

courses.title: Directed Group Studies for Advanced Undergraduates
courses.description: Seminars for the group study of selected topics which will vary from semester to semester.

courses.title: Designing Information Devices and Systems I
courses.description: Focuses on the fundamentals of designing modern information devices and systems that interface with the real world. Provides a comprehensive foundation for core EECS topics in signal processing, learning, control, and circuit design while introducing key linear-algebraic concepts.

courses.title: Designing Information Devices and Systems II
courses.description: A follow-on to EECS 16A, focusing on designing and building modern information devices and systems. Introduces core EECS topics in machine learning, circuit design, control, and signal processing.

courses.title: Completion of work in Electrical Engineering 16A
courses.description: Enables students with a background in linear algebra and/or basic circuit theory to complete the work in EECS 16A, preparing for EECS 16B or EE47E.

courses.title: Completion of work in Electrical Engineering 16B
courses.description: Allows students to complete the work in EECS 16B, focusing on the fundamentals of designing information devices and systems.

courses.title: Introduction to Robotics
courses.description: An introduction to robotics covering the fundamentals of kinematics, dynamics, control of robot manipulators, robotic vision, sensing, and motion planning.

courses.title: Robotic Manipulation and Interaction
courses.description: A sequel to EECS C106A, covering areas of robotics and active vision at a deeper level, including control of multi-fingered hands, mobile robots, SLAM, and active vision.

courses.title: Probability and Random Processes
courses.description: Covers the fundamentals of probability and random processes useful in fields such as networks, communication, signal processing, and control.

courses.title: Optimization Models in Engineering
courses.description: An introduction to optimization models and their applications, emphasizing numerically tractable problems such as linear or constrained least-squares optimization.

courses.title: Introduction to Embedded and Cyber Physical Systems
courses.description: Introduces the basics of modeling, analysis, and design of embedded cyber-physical systems, integrating computation with physical processes.

courses.title: Introduction to Digital Design and Integrated Circuits
courses.description: Provides an introduction to digital and system design, focusing on the design of large digital modules for FPGAs and ASICs.

courses.title: Application Specific Integrated Circuits Laboratory
courses.description: A lab that lays the foundation of modern digital design, focusing on rapid design space exploration and implementation of large digital systems.

courses.title: Field-Programmable Gate Array Laboratory
courses.description: Covers the design of digital systems with FPGA platforms, including digital synthesis, partitioning, placement, routing, and simulation tools.

courses.title: Introduction to Robotics
courses.description: Introduces robotics fundamentals including kinematics, dynamics, control, and vision, concluding with current applications of robotics.

courses.title: Robotic Manipulation and Interaction
courses.description: Covers dynamics and control of robotic manipulators and interaction with the environment, focusing on design and human-robot interactions.

courses.title: Computational Principles for High-dimensional Data Analysis
courses.description: Introduces geometric and statistical concepts for low-dimensional models in high-dimensional data analysis, spanning theory, algorithms, and applications.

courses.title: Numerical Simulation and Modeling
courses.description: A detailed introduction to the fundamental principles of numerical simulation and modeling in various engineering domains.

courses.title: Formal Methods: Specification, Verification, and Synthesis
courses.description: Introduction to the theory and practice of formal methods for the design and analysis of systems, focusing on algorithmic techniques for specification, verification, and synthesis.

courses.title: Statistical Signal Processing
courses.description: Connects classical statistical signal processing with modern statistical and machine learning theory and applications, focusing on concrete algorithms and real applications.

courses.title: Digital Image Processing
courses.description: Covers computational methods as applied to digital imagery, focusing on image sensing, acquisition, sampling, quantization, and processing with an introduction to modern methods.

courses.title: Optimization Models in Engineering
courses.description: An introduction to optimization models and their applications, from machine learning and statistics to decision-making and control.

courses.title: Cyber Physical System Design Principles and Applications
courses.description: Principles of embedded system design, focusing on design methodologies, platform-based design, communication-based design, performance estimation, and real-time requirements.
